txt.en: 'Well now, I remember you! Did we briefly speak of dragons in Erebor not too long ago? Ah yes, that is what I thought!\n\n'I have come to Ered Mithrin seeking lost history and knowledge. There is much of dwarf culture buried here in the mountains. I suspect that even this fortress, Skarháld, may hold some secrets yet. Have a look around and perhaps we will find something that the Zhélruka have not!'
There is nothing of interest in this chest
That may have been food once...
Bring the old maps to Rúni

Rúni pores over the old maps.\n\n'Oh, this is too good not to share. I will have to show the Zhélruka as well! Do you know what these maps contain? One map is of Thikil-gundu, an old keep north-west of here.  Another map is of Glitgróf, a mine to the north. The third map is of Stormlind, a crafting hall north-east of here. These maps will assist in planning expeditions. You have found something very helpful, very helpful indeed!'
Rúni, a Lore-master from Erebor, has journeyed to the Grey Mountains seeking lost history and knowledge. He suspects that even the fortress of Skarháld may hold secrets.
Rúni can be found in Skarháld.\n\nYou should bring the old maps to Rúni.
There is nothing useful in this chest
Whatever was in here is just dust now
Old chests may be hidden in Skarháld.\n\nYou should search any old chests that you find in Skarháld.
